message.content:
To determine the cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the period, we need to look at the balance sheet and identify the line item labeled as "Beginning Balance" under "Cash and Cash Equivalents."

In the provided problem, the balance sheet section shows:

| Account | Initial_amount | Initial_date | End_amount | End_date |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Cash on Hand | 145666.48 | 2024-01-29 | ... | ... |

Additionally, the cash flow statement indicates:

| Cash and Cash Equivalents | ... | 2024-01-29 |
| Beginning Balance  | 8000000.00 | 2024-01-29 |

The line "Beginning Balance" refers to the cash and cash equivalents at the start of the period, which matches the common accounting practice.

Therefore, the value of cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the period is 8,000,000.00.

---

{"solution": {"value": "8000000.00"}}
